channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Foot path closed on bridge causing danger, 20th June
item.description:
Bridge on Arle road north side footpath is blocked by barriers. People are supposed to cross but the road here is very dangerous as speeding cars coming over bridge cannot see people crossing the other side, from either direction . The barriers have also been knocked down and strewn around. People need to be aware to cross much further away. from the bridge. Seems poorly thought through
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arle Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed

item.title: Dog mess just before entrance to alleyway, 20th June
item.description:
Yet again dog mess at alleyway. On Tensing Rd, just before you enter the alleyway which cuts through to Hillary Rd.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Tensing Road, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: Bridlepath has been deliberately blocked with wood and branches, 20th June
item.description:
Where the bridlepath exits the Witcombe park field and enters the wood beside the Buckholt Road the route of the bridlepath has been blocked with piles of branches and wood, clearly deliberately. The only way to access the bridlepath is through a gap to the left which has a large metal grid (old cattle grid? gate) lying on the ground which is lethal if a horse got its hoof caught in it. It is impossible to avoid. The is dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Buckholt Road, Stroud
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are roadworks signs at the junction of Brockhampton Lane and Hyde lane which obstruct the view of Hyde lane when pulling out of Brockhampton Lane. Furthermore with the way the lanes have been arranged when turning right from Hyde lane into Brockhampton Lane I was nearly rear ended, 20th June
item.description:
The junction of Brockhampton Lane and Hyde lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge dip in road, 20th June
item.description:
There is a big dip in the road outside number 50 upper park street on the turning point, itâ€™s sinking rapidly and causing concern that it will be a big sink hole similar to a issue we had down this road a few months ago

item.title: Overgrown Verges Poor Visibility on Highcross to Cirencester rd, 20th June
item.description:
Problem is high verges & undergrowth seriously impacting visibility on a single track road from Highcross to Highgate Farm GL53 9PG & onto the underpass. This narrow lane has a national speed limit Which due to the continuing A417 Brockworth to Brimsfield Cowley road about closures & diversions this lane is experiencing a much higher volume of non local traffic. Needless to say some people are not driving to the conditions, giving dog walkers cyclists etc very little time to react or being able to get out of the way due to land topography unkept verges & shrubs

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicles and building work blocking pavement, 20th June
item.description:
Pavements blocked altogether by building paraphernalia and vehicles. Impossible for anyone with a wheelchair or pushchair to pass - even pedestrians are pushed into the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury

item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Dumped trailer., 20th June
item.description:
This has been reported several time by myself and my neighbours. there is and has been for many month a trailer full of rubbish with container around it. what is in the containers is anyones guess. since i reported this there has been lots of rubbish added to it and a refrigerator on the path . i am told the owner of the trailer is not worried about what happens to it. council staff water trees and empty bins in the road has any of them reported this eyesore and what could be a health hazard? it seems that as it's only hester way it get put on the back burner.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Newton Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 20th June
item.description:
(See REF: 22079647) - Customer states there has been some utilities work at the Well Walk end of the churchyard pathway. We see that the utility chaps have put down black tarmac on the pathway â€“ rather than the carefully selected resin-type surface. Pathway not reinstated properly after utility works.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner overgrown grass verge, 20th June
item.description:
Corner grass verges outside 34 Abbotswood Road still not cut but opposite Corner now chopped down? If I had the correct tools I would attempt to cut it myself (even though we are in our mid 70's). Please urgently arrange for this overgrown grass to be cut.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbotswood Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
